definition: to grow (prettier etc)/to mature into/to blossom

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The child blossomed into a beauty.
sentences.chinese: 那个女孩出落为了一个美人。

sentences.english: Her daughter is blossoming into a beautiful girl.
sentences.chinese: 她儿出落一个美丽的孩。

sentences.english: Seeing LOLI age and length, Chula's increasingly a sign.
sentences.chinese: 眼看着LOLI年纪日长，出落的越发的标志。

sentences.english: Xu Chouzi's eldest daughter in casual grows into a big girl.
sentences.chinese: 徐丑子的大女儿在不经意间便出落成为一个大闺女。

definition: slender and elegant (of a woman)
attractive and intelligent/charming/elegant
lit. a girl changes eighteen times between childhood and womanhood (idiom)/fig. a young woman is very different from the little girl she once was
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
to have bright eyes and white teeth
delicate and pretty
pretty/with delicate features
(of fruit etc) fresh/(of a person etc) full of life/healthy-looking/(of eyes) moist and bright/lustrous
good-looking and intelligent (idiom)
dainty
handsome/pretty
pleasant/agreeable/a person after one's heart (charming person)/a gifted person
delicate as a flower, refined as a precious jade (idiom)/(of a woman) exquisite
graceful/charming/feminine
